newsitem.title: DUBAI: Floods cause $20 mln damage in northwest Iran.
newsitem.headline: Floods cause $20 mln damage in northwest Iran.

text.p: Rain, hail and floods destroyed 16,000 hectares (40,000 acres) of farmland in northwestern Iran over the past 10 days, causing damage of 60 billion rials ($20 million), Iran's news agency said on Saturday.

Mahmoud Ahmadi-Nejad, governor-general of the affected Ardebil province, said two villagers had lost their lives and 884 heads of cattle were killed as a result of floods triggered by torrential rains, IRNA said.
"The floods also cut off roads linking the rural districts and inflicted damage on roads, bridges and the irrigation network in various urban and rural areas," Ahmadi-Nejad said, as quoted by IRNA.
Relief aid, including tents, foodstuffs and other essential goods have been distributed among the flood victims, IRNA said. ($1=3,000 rials)
